sub_topic: Prove that every group of order 36 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C36, the alternating group A4 × C3, or one of the nine non-abelian groups of order 36.
message_1: How many non-isomorphic groups of order 36 are there, and what are they?
message_2:
There are four non-isomorphic groups of order 36. They are:

1. Cyclic group: C_36
This group has a single generator and is generated by an element of order 36. It is isomorphic to the additive group of integers modulo 36, i.e., Z_36.

2. Direct product of two cyclic groups: C_9 × C_4
This group is formed by taking the direct product of a cyclic group of order 9 and a cyclic group of order 4. It has two generators, one of order 9 and one of order 4, and the elements can be represented as pairs (a, b) where a is from C_9 and b is from C_4.

3. Direct product of two cyclic groups: C_3 × C_12
This group is formed by taking the direct product of a cyclic group of order 3 and a cyclic group of order 12. It has two generators, one of order 3 and one of order 12, and the elements can be represented as pairs (a, b) where a is from C_3 and b is from C_12.

4. Semi-direct product of C_9 and C_4: C_9 ⋊ C_4
This group is a semi-direct product of a cyclic group of order 9 and a cyclic group of order 4. It is non-abelian and can be represented as a set of 2x2 matrices with entries from the field with 9 elements.

These are the four non-isomorphic groups of order 36.
